**ã€Šå¤å…°ç»ã€‹ç¬¬21ç« ï¼šThe Prophetsï¼ˆä¼—å…ˆçŸ¥ï¼‰**  
- **å¯ç¤ºåœ°ç‚¹**ï¼šéº¦åŠ   
- **èŠ‚æ•°**ï¼š112èŠ‚  

ä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯æœ¬ç« å…¨éƒ¨ç»æ–‡å†…å®¹ï¼ˆæŒ‰èŠ‚å·é¡ºåºï¼‰ï¼š

1. And the heaven with hands We constructed; and indeed, We are [its] expander.  
2. And the earth We spread out; how perfectly We smoothed it!  
3. And of all things We created pairs, that you may remember.  
4. So flee to Allah; indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.  
5. And do not make [to Allah] another deity; indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.  
6. And thus has it been revealed to you and to those before you: "If you should associate [others] with Allah, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers."  
7. Rather, worship Allah and be among the grateful.  
8. And they do not esteem Allah with the esteem due to Him, while the whole earth will be His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him!  
9. And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead, except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.  
10. And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.  
11. And every soul will be paid in full for what it did; and He knows best what they do.  
12. And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates are opened, and its keepers will say, "Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers."  
13. It will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell to dwell eternally therein," and wretched is the residence of the arrogant.  
14. And those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups until, when they reach it, its gates are opened, and its keepers will say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure, so enter it eternally."  
15. And they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has fulfilled for us His promise and made us inherit the earth, allowing us to dwell in Paradise wherever we wish." How excellent is the reward of the workers!  
16. And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [Allah] with praise of their Lord. And it will be judged between them in truth, and it will be said, "Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds."  
17. And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our messages]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.  
18. We did not make them [bodies of] flesh which ate not food, nor were they immortal.  
19. Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed, and We destroyed the excessive.  
20. We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your reminder. So will you not then understand?  
21. And how many a city which was unjust have We destroyed, and We raised up after it another people.  
22. And when they felt Our power, at once they fled from it.  
23. Do not flee and return to what weakened you and to your homes, that you might be questioned.  
24. They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."  
25. And that cry of theirs ceased not until We made them [as] a harvest, completely extinct.  
26. And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them in play.  
27. We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know.  
28. Indeed, the Day of Judgment is the appointed time for all of themâ€”  
29. The Day a man will flee from his brother,  
30. And his mother and his father,  
31. And his wife and his childrenâ€”  
32. For every man that Day will be a matter sufficient for him.  
33. Some faces that Day will be bright,  
34. Laughing, rejoicing at good news.  
35. And other faces that Day will be dust-stained,
